academy-of-the-dazed.title: Academy of the Dazed
academy-of-the-dazed.description: The "Academy of the Dazed" was the center of intellectual life in Siena around the 1550s. It was founded between 1525 and 1527 as a gathering place for aristocracy.

grand-canal-1.title: Grand Canal
grand-canal-1.description: The Grand Canal is a canal in Venice, Italy. It is 3800 meters long and splits the historic centre in two parts.

piazza-del-campo.title: Piazza del Campo
piazza-del-campo.description: Piazza del Campo is the principal public space of the historical center of Siena, Tuscany and is regarded as one of Europe's greatest medieval squares. It is renowned worldwide for its shell shape and for the Palio horse race.

teatro-massimo-of-palermo.title: Teatro Massimo of Palermo
teatro-massimo-of-palermo.description: The Teatro Massimo Vittorio Emanuele is an opera house and opera company located on the Piazza Verdi in Palermo, Sicily. It was dedicated to King Victor Emanuel II. It is the biggest in Italy, and one of the largest of Europe (the third after the Op√©ra National de Paris and the K. K. Hof-Opernhaus in Vienna), renowned for its perfect acoustics.

piazza-pio-ii.title: Piazza Pio II
piazza-pio-ii.description: The piazza is dedicated to one of the most important Renaissance figures from the city of Piena, Enea Silvio Piccolomini, who became Pope Pius II. In 1462, he commissioned architect Bernardo Rossellino to transform the medieval hamlet, the hometown of Corsignano.

church-of-the-most-holy-redeemer.title: Church of the Most Holy Redeemer
church-of-the-most-holy-redeemer.description: Church of the Most Holy Redeemer, commonly known as Il Redentore, is a 16th-century Roman Catholic church designed by the architect Andrea Palladio located on Giudecca island in the city of Venice, Italy.

lazzaretto-vecchio.title: Lazzaretto Vecchio
lazzaretto-vecchio.description: The Lazzaretto Vecchio is an island of the Venetian Lagoon, northern Italy, located near the Lido of Venice. Between 1403 and 1630 it housed a hospital which cared for people during the plague epidemics and as a leprosarium.

chiesa-di-sgiovannino-della-staffa.title: Chiesa di S.Giovannino della Staffa
chiesa-di-sgiovannino-della-staffa.description: San Giovannino della Staffa, also known as San Giovannino in Pantaneto is a Renaissance style, Roman Catholic church located on Piazetta Virgilio Grassi, in the Contrada del Leocorno, in the city of Siena, region of Tuscany, Italy.

contrada-of-the-dragon-headquarter.title: Contrada of the Dragon Headquarter
contrada-of-the-dragon-headquarter.description: The Contrada of the Dragon is one of the seventeen contrade, historical divisions of the city of Siena.

parent.title: Grand Tour
parent.description: Enjoy a breathtaking digital journey to explore Italy's gems and discover the stories hidden behind some well-known Italian treasures.
